item.title: Fly tipped household waste, 25th July
item.description:
Mutiple black bags and rubbish has been fly tipped in the river by the electric building. This is next to a primary and nursery school. There is a house address on one of the boxes which may identify the person/company that did it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holbeach Gardens, Blackfen, Sidcup, London

item.title: Uneven pavement, 25th July
item.description:
The paving slabs - about 8 - have become uneven. The danger here is the high number of OAPs living on the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Sandy Lane, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders debris partially blocking the access road to the rear of properties on Howard Avenue, DA5. May be linked to previously reported fly tipped material a little further East on the border with the POS Riverside Walk (between Penhill and Albany). Please note the photographing showing a letter from a local GO which should enable you to ID the property and by extension the offending builder, 25th July
item.description:
The rubbish. on both sites is dangerous with exposed nails etc and potentially biohazard material that looks like used swabs or plasters.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Howard Avenue, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The door to the council block (flats 18 - 28 Sigdon Road) is broken, 25th July
item.description:
The door is broken to the council block at 18-28 sigdon road, so anyone can enter. Please fix it! Thanks!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sigdon Road, Hackney, London

item.title: 4 bags of building rubbish dumped, 25th July
item.description:

item.title: Constant Flytipping, 25th July
item.description:
Our building's bin room is constantly being used by fly-tippers with furniture and white good amongst other things being left in the doorway blocking the entrance meaning domestic waste piles up in the communal area attracting all kinds of vermin. This has been an issue for a long time and is made worse in summer months by the heat.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 150, Spa Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
